Show.Name: 7 Lives Of Chance
Show.ShortDescription:
Confront your fears, one balloon at a time.
In this psychedelic comedy, a lone red balloon, dearly cherished from childhood, multiplies as it leads Chance on a journey of acknowledgement.

Show.Name: A&I Forum: Making Social Media Work for Artists
Show.ShortDescription:
Making Social Media Work for Artists. Art and entertainment leaders meet innovation and business leaders for
dynamic conversation and visual presentations around cutting-edge topics. Cinequest fuses creativity and innovation to empowr, and the Cinequest Film
Festival is the place to discover technologies and paradigms to revolutionize the experiences of making media and connecting with audiences. If you're an artist, technologist, executive, or movie lover, A&I Forums are must-attend
experiences to stay ahead of the curve.

Show.Name: A&I Forum: 4K - Experience Restoration to New Cinema
Show.ShortDescription: 4K: Giving Audiences An Amped Experience, Restoration To New Cinema, Theaters To Home. An inside look into the art of film restoration. In the presentation, he will discuss the concepts of the traditional photochemical process and how the high-end digital technologies of today are applied to this workflow. Mr. Crisp will showcase before-and-after clips of titles restored in 4K by Sony Pictures so you can see what Sony is doing to restore and preserve the Columbia, TriStar, and Screen Gems libraries so that they look the best that they can for your theatre’s screen.

Show.Name: Abigail
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 3: Choice and Effect. At the end of what she hopes to be her last day of work, a young gas station attendant named Abigail attempts to leave town permanently. Fragmented details of her life unravel, as she treks across the decaying wasteland called home.

CustomProperty.Name: Producer
CustomProperty.Value: Seth Blogier and Matthew James Reilly

Show.Name: About Him (O Nem)
Show.ShortDescription: Good versus Evil isn’t always so black and white. As a Russian gangster and music producer, Dennis had it all, but everything unravels after his wife commits suicide. He funded his wife's music career with borrowed money from the mafia, but when they come to collect after her funeral, he cannot pay.

Show.Name: African Race
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 2: Looking For Something New. The young Elias builds his own, alone, unarmed, made from scavenged parts collected in landfills in their region. With this bike he will embark on the long journey to the capital, and engage in the race of his life.

Show.Name: After Christmas
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 8: Student Shorts. Cole is home for the holidays... and now they're over. A humorous look at the trials and tribulations of returning to the family home.

Show.Name: After You
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 7: Time, Space, And In Between. A doorman at a Dublin city hotel spends many happy years opening his beloved door for the hotel residents. One day, much to his horror, he discovers that his job and happiness may be under threat.

Show.Name: Aftermath
Show.ShortDescription:
Chris Penn, Tony Danza, Anthony Michael Hall and Frank Whaley star in this suspenseful powerhouse.

Tom Fiorini (Anthony Michael Hall, The Dead Zone) owns a successful construction company. After his long time foreman goes missing, events take a drastic turn for the worse. During the search for his foreman, Tom plummets down a slippery slope of violence and hired hit men, only to find the fire with which he plays is much hotter than he could have ever expected.

Show.Name: Agnus Dei
Show.ShortDescription:
I was born from the ones I shouldn't, lived with those I mustn't, and killed the one I shouldn't.

Even the greatest can fall to great depths. Peter once sought peace. He taught before the Kosovo War’s deterioration of his homeland made it impossible. He fought for his “defenseless” mother against the drunk he thought was his father.

Show.Name: The Almost Man (Mer Eller Mindre Mann)
Show.ShortDescription:
Immaturity versus Adulthood: two will enter, one will leave.

Uneasy feelings about becoming a father and adult cause Henrik to act out in hilariously inappropriate ways in this offbeat comedy. On one hand, he wants to ignore adulthood and spend time fooling around with his friends. On the other, he must grow up and make his relationship work with Tone, the mother of his unborn child.

Show.Name: Anamnesis
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 5: Mindbenders. When Adam wakes up in a childhood memory, he figures he must be dreaming. But as his girlfriend, Hannah, leads him deeper into his subconscious, he begins to realize the truth...

Show.Name: Angaza Design
Show.ShortDescription: Plays before the feature film Wampler's Ascent. Recipient of The Tech Awards 2012 Katherine M. Swanson Young Innovator Award, Angaza Design’s SoLite provides a low-cost energy source solution to the 1.5 billion around the world that do not have access to electricity or the finances to purchase quality solar products. Available to customers in Tanzania, Kenya, and Zambia, SoLite is a pay-as-you-go solution to problems ranging from charging cell phones to having light while preparing dinner or doing schoolwork. The energy payments are cheaper than weekly kerosene expenditures, and it’s perfect to brighten up a home during dark nights.

Show.Name: Another Christmas
Show.ShortDescription: Plays before the feature film Panihida. A boy is waiting for his parents to come back from Italy, to spend Christmas together. He hasn’t seen them for a year. On this Christmas, he must face the major crisis of his life: Is there a Santa Claus or not?

CustomProperty.Name: Cast
CustomProperty.Value: Marius Ionut Pacurar, Maria Seles, Ovidiu Crisan, Anca Hanu

Show.Name: AutoDrive
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 3: Choice and Effect. When Steve's new GPS suddenly asks for help, he follows her instructions from sunny suburbia into the depths of an abandoned warehouse to a mysterious door. What lies beyond transforms Steve's life in a test of true heroism.

Show.Name: Balkan Melodie
Show.ShortDescription:
Some of the most beautiful music in the world, and the devoted couple who brought it to us.

Known and loved for decades by aficionados, the Bulgarian Women singers (“Le mystère des voix Bulgares”), Zamfir and others were completely unknown in the West in the 1950s when two young lovers Marcel & Catherine Cellier first visited behind the Iron Curtain.

Show.Name: The Believers
Show.ShortDescription:
Two mavericks try to change the world – and pay the price.

In 1989, Martin Fleischmann and Stanley Pons, two scientists from the University of Utah, achieved near rock-star status when they made a startling discovery: cold fusion could solve our energy needs.

Show.Name: Better Than A C
Show.ShortDescription: Plays before the feature film Oh Boy. You cannot start the race if you don’t know why you are running.

Show.Name: BioLite Stove
Show.ShortDescription: Plays before the feature film Wampler's Ascent. Instead of risking their lungs and life and contributing carbon emissions to the atmosphere, users of BioLite can cook on this wood-burning stove that converts heat into energy, reduces smoke emissions by ninety-five percent, and reduces fuel consumption by fifty percent. Earning The Tech Awards 2012 Nokia Health Award, BioLite has uses ranging from cooking to charging electrical devices.

Show.Name: Bless You
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 2: Looking For Something New. A short, children's comedy about Izzy, a 10 year old girl attending Mass at her local church who encounters an awkward situation with Pete, a 10 year old boy with a cold.

Show.Name: bona nox
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 2: Looking For Something New. Since mommy died in a car accident, daddy is crying all the time. And I move with 'Wheelchair', my wheelchair. But I can fix everything : I have a time machine. So, I will save mommy in the past and fix my legs in the future. But I need something to succe

Show.Name: Boop Beep
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 7: Time, Space, And In Between. Boop Beep' is a handcrafted love story about a lonely little cardboard box that tries to win the hear of the girlbot next door. It's a homemade film, which attempts to eschew perfection in favor of the beauty of happy mistakes.

Show.Name: Brother
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 8: Student Shorts. Brother is a humanoid robot who has one job to build, but fails in creating successful pieces. Once his emotions get in the way of creating something, he realizes that maybe it was just the thing he needed. Though it was in front of him all along, Brother learns to put "heart" into anything he creates.

Show.Name: Butterflies
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Animated Worlds. A young artist sits on the sidewalk, struggling to make a living. She sells drawings to passersby. A businessman who recognises her talents offers her a paying job. The prospect seems inviting but the reality threatens to kill her imagination...

Show.Name: Buzkashi Boys (Pesaran-e-Buzkashi)
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 1: The Battles We Fought. Set against the dramatic landscape of contemporary Afghanistan and the national sport of Buzkashi - a brutal game of horse polo played with a dead goat - Buzkashi Boys tells the compelling coming of age story of two best friends.

Show.Name: Bydlo
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Animated Worlds. In Bydlo, which means cattle in Polish, Patrick Bouchard reinterprets the symphonic movement of the same name from Modest Petrovich Mussorgskys opus Pictures at an Exhibition.

Show.Name: Calcutta Taxi
Show.ShortDescription: Shorts Program 7: Time, Space, And In Between. Calcutta Taxi is set in the grimy backdrop of a city going through a political crisis, unraveling the story of three lives that coincide and affect each other. Each one having lost and found some things in this chance encounter of life.

Show.Name: Cardboard Titanics: Smart People Being Stupid
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 6: Docu-Nation. Delusional people build, row, and race boats made solely of cardboard and duck tape in an insane effort to recapture the American dream.

Show.Name: Chaos (Desordres)
Show.ShortDescription:
Be careful whom you let into your home.

Escaping the madness of city life in Paris, a teacher, Vincent, and his wife, Marie, move to a farm in the south of France with their son in hopes of a quieter life. But the craziness they have left behind may be more welcome once one of Vincent’s students, Thibault, intrudes upon the family’s life, begins an affair with Vincent’s wife, and becomes the catalyst in a failing marriage.

Show.Name: Chapman
Show.ShortDescription:
Sometimes to move on, you have to relive your past.

When a disturbing letter arrives at his nowhere job, Alex leaves his nowhere life and returns to the mountains of Colorado where he comes face to face with the demons that have haunted him for over a decade.

Show.Name: Maverick Spirit Chef Dominique Crenn
Show.ShortDescription: In the culinary crush, with its abundance of crative cuisine, fueled by the freshest of ingredients and celebrity chefs, there exists and embarrassment of riches that seems almost unfair. America's appetite for gastronomic excellence is for real. Dominique Crenn, chef/owner of Atelier Crenn in San Francisco, understand and bring sher maverick sensibilities to keep the dishes honest and the quality high.
Show.ExtraHTML: VIP All Acess Passes are available on our Festival Pass Page

Show.Name: Chittagong
Show.ShortDescription:
Ordinary boys, extraordinary triumph.

Set in British-occupied India of the 1930s, Chittagong is a true story about an unassuming fourteen-year-old boy, Jhunku, finding his place amongst the rampage. On the path to attend Oxford, he is betrayed by the man who is helping him and is left with the tormenting ridicule of his peers.

Show.Name: Maverick Spirit - Chris Cookson
Show.ShortDescription: As President of Sony Pictures Technologies, Cookson oversees the development and implementation of the studio's technology policy and processes. He also serves as Sony Pictures' chief liaison with other Sony Corporation businesses in the area of technology.

Show.Name: Maverick Spirit - Chuck Palahniuk
Show.ShortDescription:
The only way to find true happiness is to risk being completely cut open.
- Chuck Palahniuk

For almost twenty years, no other author has pounced harder on the minds of readers than Chuck Palahniuk. From characters that may or may not exist to underground demolition derby, Palahniuk has created strange, dark, sometimes touching, and often hilarious worlds. His work synthesizes a wide-range of influences into stories that are virtually impossible to slot into any single genre or category.

Show.Name: Cicada Princess
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Animated Worlds. For sixteen years cicadas live underground. They emerge for one glorious night to live out their lives in hope of finding happiness and maybe... love.

Show.Name: The Citizen
Show.ShortDescription:
September 10, 2001: Not the best day for Middle Eastern Ibrahim to become an American.

Yearning to leave behind his life of misfortune in the Middle East, Ibrahim Jarrah wins the U.S. Green Card Lottery for a chance to become an American citizen.

Show.Name: City Baby
Show.ShortDescription:
Live free. Live young. Live like you don’t have to grow up.

Sexy. Style-conscious. Extreme love affairs. Complicated friendships. Life happens all too quickly when Cloey is reluctantly plucked from her comfort zone and complete reliance on others is overturned – a secure relationship with her boyfriend unravels, her childhood best friend is moving away and daddy’s (Daniel Baldwin) checkbook closes

Show.Name: Cliff
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 7: Time, Space, And In Between. He's a sexual savior. Hero to the women that society forgot. But when Cliff unexpectadly meets the girl of his dreams, he may be the one that needs to be saved.

Show.Name: Come on, Eddy! (Allez, Eddy!)
Show.ShortDescription:
Aim to be the difference.

Eleven-year-old Freddy is the son of Andre, a fourth generation butcher in a small town. They have a tumultuous relationship emanating from the fact that Andre cannot accept Freddy or his condition as “normal.” Their worlds get flipped upside down when a new supermarket, Magique, is set to open.

Show.Name: Congratulations!
Show.ShortDescription:
Detective Dan Skok's methods are, to say the least, unusual.

As a member of Missing Persons unit, Detective Skok realizes the first 72 hours are the most critical in any investigation. When a young boy goes missing inside his own house, Skok immediately recognizes the unusualness of the case and takes the opportunity to have his team move in with the family and become residents of the crime scene.

As a member of Missing Persons unit, Detective Skok realizes the first 72 hours are the most critical in any investigation. When a young boy goes missing inside his own house, Skok immediately recognizes the unusualness of the case and takes the opportunity to have his team move in with the family and become residents of the crime scene.

Show.Name: Cops
Show.ShortDescription: Buster's attempt to become a successful businessman lead to chaos and the ultimate silent film police chase.

Show.Name: Couch
Show.ShortDescription: Plays before the feature film One Small Hitch. Growing up is hard to do. That's why Casey McElveen never even tried. Margin Call Producer, Neal Dodson, presents Couch.

Show.Name: Crisalida
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 6: Docu-Nation. Crisalida, which means "cocoon of an incubating butterfly", is the name of an 86-year-old woman who watches the world through her bedroom window. Over the course of a Sunday in her small Cuban town, her past and present converge in profoundly ironic, unsettling ways.

Show.Name: Cubamerican
Show.ShortDescription:
From Castros Cuba to America... Remarkable stories of immigration and success.
When Fidel Castro revealed the true nature of his dicatorship, thousands of Cubans, including many who had supported him, escaped to the U.S. seeking freedom and a better life.

Showing.ShortDescription:
From Castros Cuba to America... Remarkable stories of immigration and success.
When Fidel Castro revealed the true nature of his dicatorship, thousands of Cubans, including many who had supported him, escaped to the U.S. seeking freedom and a better life.

Show.Name: Curiosity
Show.ShortDescription: Plays before the feature film The Only Real Game. A 12-year-old gives her view of the force that motivates us to investigate the universe's great mysteries.

Show.Name: Dancing With The Trees
Show.ShortDescription: Plays before the feature film Stable Life. Follow the Biloxi, MS based Ohr O'Keefe Museum through it's development by architect Frank Gehry, it's destruction by Hurricane Katrina and it's triumphant rebuilding. Learn the story of George Ohr, the mad potter of Biloxi.

Show.Name: David Sedaris's The Learning Curve
Show.ShortDescription: Plays before the feature film Leave Of Absence. An adaptation of New York Times best selling author David Sedaris's 'The Learning Curve' from his book 'Me Talk Pretty One Day.' The Learning Curve follows Sedaris as he becomes a creative writing teacher at a local college.

Show.Name: The Dead Man And Being Happy (El Muerto y Ser Feliz)
Show.ShortDescription:
On the road with a hired killer who doesn’t kill and a woman who doesn’t look like women in films.

This low-key tale of a hit man on his last legs and the woman he picks up on the road mixes Argentinean minimalism with a fascinating sound design, ever so slightly surreal dark-edged Borgesian set pieces, a voiceover narration reminiscent of "Historias Extraordinarias" (Cinequest 2009), and more than a hint of laughter.

Show.Name: The Deep (Djupio)
Show.ShortDescription:
In the frigid waters off the shore of Iceland, a man fights for his survival.

In a film truly deserving of its Oscar submission, director Baltasar Kormakur (101 Reykjavik) brings this true story to life with power and brilliance. In March 1984, a rusty fishing trawler capsizes in rough waters and the entire crew is swept overboard.

Show.Name: Detonator
Show.ShortDescription:
With change comes sacrifice.

From rocker to family man, this captivating debut reveals the strife we face when it’s time to grow up. The rhythm of Sully’s (Lawrence Levine, Gabi on the Roof In July) life drastically changes when he abandons Philadelphia’s gritty punk rock scene for suburban simplicity. Now, in a dull office job, Sully must support his family, while the lifestyle he had lead is tough to let go.

Show.Name: Dharavi Diary
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 8: Student Shorts. Re-developers are destroying the Dharavi slum. Its one million residents struggle to keep their hopes and dreams alive.

Show.Name: Doktor Fang
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 5: Mindbenders. After being mugged by Freud and Jung, brilliant scientist Doktor Fang creates a machine to prove his own theory about the nature of dreams. But on his return from the patent office he discovers his assistant murdered, the machine gone, and the two assassins trying to kill him.

Show.Name: Don't Push Me
Show.ShortDescription: Plays before the feature film Running Wild: The Life Of Dayton O. Hyde. The world’s rough at any age, but a kind word can make it just a bit softer.

Show.Name: Dose of Reality
Show.ShortDescription:
When the tables turn, nothing is as it seems.

When the bar doors closed one evening, the night was far from over. After Matt, a handsome, young bartender, discovers an attractive, bloodied woman passed out on the bathroom floor, the descent into utter chaos begins.

Show.Name: Dr. Strangelove
Show.ShortDescription:
Peter Sellers, George C. Scott, Sterling Hayden, and Keenan Wynn star in Stanley Kubrick's classic comedy.
Through a series of military and political accidents, a pair of psychotic senior military officers hatch an ingenious, foolproof, and irrevocable plan to unleash a wing of B52 bombers and their nuclear payloads on strategic targets inside Russia.

Through a series of military and political accidents, a pair of psychotic senior military officers hatch an ingenious, foolproof, and irrevocable plan to unleash a wing of B52 bombers and their nuclear payloads on strategic targets inside Russia.

Show.Name: Dreamer
Show.ShortDescription:
A powerful story of love, hope, and what it truly means to be American.

All Joe’s ever wanted is to achieve his dreams in the country he’s loved and known all his life. With a college education and a good job, he’s well on his way to living the American Dream.

Show.Name: Eco-Fuel Africa
Show.ShortDescription: Plays before the feature film Plimpton! Starring George Plimpton As Himself. Sanga Moses’ hope to provide Africa with a clean cooking fuel after great deforestation wiped out Sub-Saharan African forests led to the rise of Eco-Fuel Africa. Simple, locally made technology has been created to allow local people to convert agricultural waste into clean cooking fuel and organic fertilizers.

Show.Name: Eden
Show.ShortDescription:
Surviving under their watch, but on her terms.

A stunning performance by Jamie Chung (Sucker Punch, The Hangover Part II) as a rebellious teen named Hyun Jae highlights Megan Griffith’s intense, award-winning abduction thriller Eden. After a night out drinking, Hyun Jae is picked up by a handsome “Mr. Wrong” and gets into his car; she never makes it home.

Showing.ShortDescription:

Show.Name: Embrace
Show.ShortDescription: Plays before the feature film We Were Children. Founders of Embrace have discovered a way to save newborn babies of low-birth rates or other unfortunate circumstances from hypothermia. Babies do not know how to react to cold so Embrace, recipient of The Tech Awards 2012 Nokia Health Award, provides mothers with low-cost infant warmers that provide them up to six hours of stable warmth.

Show.Name: Emperor
Show.ShortDescription:
Academy Award-winner Tommy Lee Jones and Lost’s Matthew Fox star in an epic drama.

Tommy Lee Jones seems he was destined to play legendary U.S. General Douglas MacArthur in director Peter Webber’s (Girl with a Pearl Earring) latest. The time is August 1945. Emperor Hirohito has surrendered to Allied Forces, and the decision on his fate falls upon MacArthur.

Show.Name: Ending In 6 Minutes
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 6: Docu-Nation. Everyone has secrets - some big, some small. Through a series of personal, intimate and random street interviews, Ending in Six Minutes explores the innermost secrets of everyday people interviewed on Australia's Sydney streets.

Show.Name: Everybody In Our Family
Show.ShortDescription:
What do they say about the road to hell and good intentions? Oh, yeah: “Hang on to your hats, folks! It’s going to be a bumpy ride!”

Marius is a divorced dentist on a short fuse. All he wants is a quiet weekend at the seaside with his daughter Sofia. What he gets is … something else.

Show.Name: The Exam (A Vizsga)
Show.ShortDescription:
In the labyrinth of state secrecy, even the watchers are watched. But who’s watching the watchers watching the watchers?

Welcome to Hungary, Christmas 1957. The state, shaken and insecure by the defeated revolution of 1956 and prodded by a renewed Stalinist atmosphere, has decreed that all security personnel must take an exam to challenge and verify their loyalty.

Show.Name: Examination
Show.ShortDescription: Plays before the feature film White Lie. Four teenage students that their end of year exams. Inside these students' minds there are vivid imaginations and different ways of expressing themselves. That's because they have dyslexia, autism or ADHD. Not all of them manage to complete the papers.

Show.Name: The Example
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Short Program 1: The Battles We Fought. Two people. A train station. An unattended Briefcase. Prejudice versus Preservation. In the war on terror, will suspicion and fear win out?

Show.Name: Exoids
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Animated Worlds. All desert slug GUS NITROUS wants is to find some precious water. But a wrong turn into the EXOIDS-occupied city of Los Angeles sets him off on a high-speed desert car chase that culminates into an epic showdown.

Show.Name: Family Meals
Show.ShortDescription:
Mom, Dad, we need to talk.

What better place to discuss things with your family than at meals? “Dear Child … you should be brave, even if it hurts …” Dana Budisavljevic has crafted a winning documentary, capturing family discussions during meals, as she and her parents and her brother discuss long-held grievances and frustrations, or unresolved issues such as her parents’ various reactions to her (dinnertime, of course) revelation that she is gay.

Show.Name: Far Out Isn't Far Enough: The Tomi Ungerer Story
Show.ShortDescription:
One man's wild, lifelong adventure of testing societal boundaries through subversive art.

Tomi Ungerer was a celebrated '50s children's author, greatly influencing others, including Maurice Sendak. In the '60s, Tomi's innovative talents produced iconic anti-war posters. But all along he had a secret passion with his art - and when it was discovered, his career was dramatically impacted.

Show.Name: Feed Me With Your Words (Nahrani Me Z Besedami)
Show.ShortDescription:
To unravel the mystery of his missing brother, a son must resolve the conflicts with his estranged father.

In hopes he will finally complete his research, Robert leaves the Slovenian countryside for Italy, but he mysteriously vanishes after encountering a peculiar homeless man. Worried about Robert’s safety, his father, Janez, and older brother, Matej, track his path in hopes of finding him. After ten years of no communication, these two now have to put their differences aside and face each other.

Show.Name: The First Hope
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 3: Choice and Effect. Johnny loves Star Wars. Matter of fact, Johnny loves just about any move he can get his hands on. On a summer afternoon, he kicks back with the Empire while his older sister Karen is left to babysit.

Show.Name: Fish Tale: Secret LIfe of Plankton
Show.ShortDescription:
Plays with the feature film The Pretty Time Bomb.
A wondrous look inside the hidden world that underpins our own food chain.

Show.Name: From Lemons
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film Habanastation. Your kids have questions, but how do you describe a day like 9/11 and how can you avoid creating a prejudice?

Show.Name: Full-Time Ministry
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 8: Student Shorts. FULL-TIME MINISTRY is a character portrait about a devout Christian man who, by day, struggles to keep his religious faith out of the public high school classroom where he teaches; by night, he is an outsider artist who creates gospel-inspired ice sculptures.

Show.Name: Ginger & Rosa
Show.ShortDescription:
Cinequest proudly opens the 2013 festival with director Sally Potter’s (Orlando) new film. Elle Fanning, Alice Englert, Annette Bening and Christina Hendricks breathe life into 1960s London in this coming-of-age story.

Inseparable best friends Ginger (Fanning) and Rosa (Englert) ditch their studies to engage in passionate discussions about politics, gender, sex, religion, and hairstyles. But when the Cuban Missile Crisis catalyzes their fears, the girls realize they are becoming less similar. While Ginger engrosses herself with thoughts of political turmoil, Rosa takes great interest in Ginger’s father (played by Alessandro Nivola).

CustomProperty.Name: Executive Producer
CustomProperty.Value: Reno Antonaides, Aaron L. Gilbert, Goetz Grossman, Heidi Levitt,, Joe Oppenheimer, Paula Alvarez Vac

Show.Name: Girl Shaped Love Drug
Show.ShortDescription:
Three coincidences, two souls, one day.

In this modern day love story, coincidence brings two strangers together on the bustling streets of lonely people in Manchester, England. The deeply philosophical, “Him” pretends to be people's guardian angel, when in actuality, he needs one the most. After seeing the confident and sweet “Her” three times in one day, “Him” decides fate is bringing them together.

Show.Name: Girl Trash
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film Somewhere Slow. No one does their chores when it comes to the home we all share – the earth.

Show.Name: The Global Citizen
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film The Kitchen. Can a country have different ethnicities without one of them, old or new, becoming superior to the rest?

Show.Name: Goldfish Go Home (Akane Iro No Yakusoku)
Show.ShortDescription:
Two kids. One mysterious blue goldfish. And a beautiful adventure.

Young Brazilian immigrant Ricardo is having real trouble settling into Japanese school, where he is bullied and can barely follow the classes. When Ricardo catches a blue goldfish that turns out to be the spirit of a Chinese Princess, the ensuing surge of interest in this rare creature forces him and his charming classmate, Hanako, to join forces to take on the mayor and the Yakuza to save their town and the livelihood of its people.

Show.Name: Grameen Foundation USA, Community Knowledge Worker Initiative
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film Plimpton! Starring George Plimpton As Himself. Without Internet access and the ability to obtain information or advice regarding agriculture or business, many farmers in poor or hard to reach rural areas do not see their businesses thriving. Grameen Foundation USA received the Flextronics Economic Development Award at The Tech Awards 2012 by creating a social enterprise that has 800 Community Knowledge Workers travel to farms and share agriculture information with small-holder farmers with their on-hand smartphones. These workers have reached 65,000 farmers in 8,800 villages worldwide.

Show.Name: The Great Journey
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film Old Stock. There’s a fork in our roads and on our plates: do we go fruits and vegetables or fries and Coke?

Show.Name: Habanastation (Havanastation)
Show.ShortDescription:
Two boys. Two worlds. One Cuba.

Raised in a wealthy neighborhood of Havana, 12-year-old Mayito has everything at his fingertips: loving and affectionate parents, delectable home-cooked meals, and, most recently, the latest PlayStation 3 video game console. His classmate Carlos, on the other hand, comes from a low-class residential district where he cleans and sells empty beer bottles just so he can save enough money to buy the kite of his dreams.

Raised in a wealthy neighborhood of Havana, 12-year-old Mayito has everything at his fingertips: loving and affectionate parents, delectable home-cooked meals, and, most recently, the latest PlayStation 3 video game console. His classmate Carlos, on the other hand, comes from a low-class residential district where he cleans and sells empty beer bottles just so he can save enough money to buy the kite of his dreams.

Show.Name: Hark
Show.ShortDescription:
Part of Shorts Program 3: Choice and Effect.
Hark is about a man who is confronted with a moral dilemma to save his own life or risk the life of another. The characters in Hark are ordinary people making choices to survive. The story draws attention to the harsh reality of human trafficking and shin

Show.Name: Maverick Spirit - Harrison Ford
Show.ShortDescription: The rarest of actors has the opportunity to create an iconic character that imprints powerfully upon the generation that first experiences the character and then throughout time. An even rarer artist is able to transcend the identification with an iconic performance and continue to create great art and characters equally as powerful. Think Bogart’s Rick. Think Harrison Ford’s Han Solo.

An even rarer artist is able to transcend the identification with an iconic performance and continue to create great art and characters equally as powerful. Think Bogart’s Rick. Think Harrison Ford’s Han Solo.

Show.Name: Herstory
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 6: Docu-Nation. This animation describes a girl's story who was taken to Java island as a comfort woman. Chung Seo-woon, the real victim of World War, narrates her story with her real voice.

Show.Name: High Noon (La Hora Señalada)
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 2: Looking For Something New. A small schoolboy accidentally offends the biggest kid of his class. Our hero will have to face his fears and insecurities, as well as the pressure of his peers, who demand a fateful encounter between them at high noon.

Show.Name: The Hindsight Bias
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 5: Mindbenders. The near future. Reclusive billionaire Morgan Nash spends his days tending to his dying catatonic wife Amy, until a eccentric scientist offers him a chance to relive his life and love all over again.

Show.Name: Hunky Dory
Show.ShortDescription:
Minnie Driver stars in this stunning musical from the producers of Billy Elliot.

It’s the summer of 1976 in Swansea. Unorthodox, free-spirited schoolteacher Vivienne (Minnie Driver) is attempting to put on an ambitious Tommy-style rock opera version of Shakespeare's The Tempest, featuring contemporary hits. Viv faces opposition from various uptight staff members, but catches a break when she persuades the headmaster to play Prospero.

Viv faces opposition from various uptight staff members, but catches a break when she persuades the headmaster to play Prospero.

Show.Name: The Hunt (Jagten)
Show.ShortDescription:
An innocent man accused of a horrendous act.

Lucas (Mikkelsen) has lived in his small, tight-knit community all his life. He has formed lifelong friendships, goes on regular hunting trips and is a divorced daycare worker hoping to win the custody of his son. The children under his care adore Lucas, including Klara, the young daughter of Lucas’ friend Theo.

Show.Name: I Am A Director
Show.ShortDescription:
Authenticity is not his strong suit.

In a mockumentary-style comedy in the vein of Christopher Guest’s Best In Show, there is one goal: make the BEST HOLLYWOOD FILM EVER! Carlos is a Puerto Rican filmmaker – one of many – aiming to make a “Hollywood” film. It has to be extravagant, dramatic, and MUST be in English.

Show.Name: Idomeneo
Show.ShortDescription: King Idomeneo returns home to Crete after the Trojan War. Terrified by a violent storm, he vows to Neptune to sacrifice the first person he meets on shore. That person is his son, Idamante, who meanwhile has fallen in love with the captive Trojan pricess Ilia. Idomeneo's dilemma is how to satisfy Neptune without killing his own son. Idomeneo is set in ancent Crete, and this unique production has sets and costumes based on Minoan art. It also includes Mozart's ballet msic, which is often omitted. Idomeneo was Moaart's favorite of all his operas. It was first performed in Munich in 1781

Show.Name: The Immigrant
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film The Racket Boys. After being deported back to his native Canada, once-famous comedian Bob London attempts a Hollywood comeback by enlisting human smugglers to sneak him across the Mexico-US border.

Show.Name: In Hanford
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 6: Docu-Nation. In Hanford is visual artist Chris Mars's fantastic exploration of real incidents in Hanford, Washington, where the local environment was poisoned as a result of cold war era nuclear arms manufacture.

Show.Name: In The Shadow (Ve Stinu)
Show.ShortDescription:
Winner of 5 Czech Film Critics' Awards Awards including Best Film, Director, and Actor!
We are in Prague 1953, and the Czech communists are in full control. In this year’s Czech Oscar submission, a complex and provocative neo-noir thriller, Police Inspector Hakl (Ivan Trojan, Visible World, Cinequest 2012 – in a tour-de-force performance) is investigation a seemingly simple case of robbery.

Show.Name: An Inaccurate Memoir
Show.ShortDescription:
The Far East meets the Wild West.

Fang leads a group of bandits who have gained notoriety for their widespread influence in this Chinese Western taking place during the Japanese Occupation. Gao, an assassin, is the only survivor of a failed mission intended to kill the Japanese Emperor’s brother. Hearing about the success of the bandits, Gao infiltrates Fang’s posse with the intent of using them to complete his mission.

Show.Name: It's The Shoes
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film One Day Or Another. A man can wear quality shoes, but no fabric, color, or sole cushion can make a man.

Show.Name: Jack to the Future
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 7: Time, Space, And In Between. Alex is about to find out just how far he's willing to go to fulfill his life long dream of time travel. All that stands in his way is a big stack of cash, a little self respect, and his best friend Jack.

Show.Name: Jack's Not Sick Anymore
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film Solace. A daughter's struggles to keep her parents together, despite her father's illness, all while moving out of her childhood home.

Show.Name: Kali the Little Vampire (Kali le petit vampire)
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Amimated Worlds. This is the story of a boy unlike other boys who dreams of finding his place in the world. He will have to face up to his personal demons and overcome his fears to find at last the way to the light.

Show.Name: Kill No Evil
Show.ShortDescription:
Plays with the feature film An Inaccurate Memoir.
Two cowboys stare down each other in a showdown. All is quiet. Or is it?

Show.Name: The Kitchen
Show.ShortDescription:
Refrigerator contents: beer, more beer, and what’s left of the cake.

Jennifer (Laura Prepon, That ‘70s Show) isn’t having a good day: She dumped her cheating boyfriend of almost three years, her friend is forcing a party on her...and she is turning 30! Her younger sister, Penny (Dreama Walker, Don’t Trust the B---- in Apartment 23) is there for her, but with bad news herself.

Show.Name: A Knock On My Door
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Amimated Worlds. Escaping a life of sadness and adversity, a young Korean boy moves to American and learns that event hough life is full of hard knocks, the time does come when it's safe to answer the door.

Show.Name: Kolona
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 1: The Battles We Fought. War. Kosovo 1999. Adem finds himself in situation that he has to choose: to save his son or his brother's son.

Show.Name: La Camioneta: The Journey of One American School Bus
Show.ShortDescription:
The inspiring journey of a bus fraught with danger.

Every day dozens of decommissioned school buses leave the United States on a southward migration that carries them to Guatemala, where they are repaired, colorfully re-painted and used as daily transportation by working class Guatemalans. La Camioneta is the enthralling story of the journey of one such bus and its owner, a man determined to survive as an entrepreneur despite overwhelming odds against his success.

Show.Name: Ladyboy
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 6: Docu-Nation. Jessica is a transsexual who is working as a prostitute in the red-light district of Bangkok. She is faced with the toughest choice of her life. To follow her boyfriend abroad and start a new life, or to stay in Bangkok and keep supporting her mother. Whatever choice she makes it will determine her future and impact the people closest to her.

Show.Name: Last Remarks
Show.ShortDescription: Shorts Program 3: Choice and Effect. In 1947, on the eve of the creation of his new country Pakistan, Arastu Jan, an isolated native servant to a British colonial master, takes a dose of poison and finds himself with ten minutes to record the confession of his brief lifetime.

Show.Name: Last Time We Checked
Show.ShortDescription: Shorts Program 7: Time, Space, And In Between. Stan, a mild-mannered gay man, has been called into the Department of Immigration to account for his marriage to a Canadian drag queen. It's not going well. Having recently won the right to marry his boyfriend, Stan now finds himself caught in the bureaucratic rotors of American government. Convinced of a conspiracy, Stan launches into a bout of hysteria driven by the fear of being separated from his love.

Show.Name: Lawrence of Arabia
Show.ShortDescription:
Winner of seven Academy Awards, the big screen is the only way to see one of the cinema's grandest epics, starring Peter O'Toole, Alec Guinness, Anthony Quinn, and Omar Sharif!
David Lean's monumental film recounts the true-life experiences of T.E. Lawrence, better known to the world as Lawrence of Arabia. A young, idealistic British officer in WWI, Lawrence (O'Toole) is assigned to the camp of Prince Felsal (Guinness), an Arab tribal Chieftain and leader in a revolt against the Turks.

Show.Name: Lead Us Not Into Temptation
Show.ShortDescription:
"Oh what a tangled web we weave, when first we practice to deceive."

When Tristan, a happily married middle-aged lawyer, helps a beautiful young woman whose broken scooter is blocking his way, he has no idea what he is getting himself into. Step by step, with Gallic precision, he is drawn into a mare’s nest full of emotional pitfalls.

Show.Name: Leave Of Absence
Show.ShortDescription:
30 days to figure out the rest of his life.

In a comedy where the mantra “If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it” plays true, the question is: Is it ever too late to “figure it all out”? Jason (Jason Thompson, General Hospital) is a thirty-something college graduate happily cohabitating with his girlfriend, but unhappily working as a waiter. When a doctor orders him to take a FMLA (Family Medical Leave of Absence) for thirty days, Jason finds himself with a newfound freedom – to slack.

Show.Name: LEHR Inc. Propane Outboard Motors
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film La Camioneta: The Journey Of One American School Bus. Small gasoline engines used by motorboats tend to emit excessive pollution; however, electrical or battery-operated engines do not offer the same performance when out on the water. LEHR Inc. created Propane Outboard Motors, patented gaseous-fueled engines that nearly eliminate pollution while at the same time being cost-effective and comparable in performance to gasoline engines.

Show.Name: Literacy Bridge Talking Book
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film The Believers. Literacy Bridge, led by Cliff Schmidt, invented the Talking Book, a battery-operated audio computer that addresses the needs of those who lack electricity and literacy. Specifically designed to answer questions pertinent to the people, Talking Book’s appearance in Ghana resulted in farmers harvesting forty-eight percent more crops and maternal lessons leading to healthier practices and behaviors.

Show.Name: Little Kaiju
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Animated Worlds. The whimsical journey of a mysterious vending machine dwelling creature who explores the shadowy corners of Tokyo after dark.

Show.Name: Lolotte
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 2: Looking For Something New. A father spends one last day with his daughter in a rundown French coastal town when he dubiously comes across a large amount of money.

Show.Name: Lonely Boy
Show.ShortDescription:
The romantic misadventures of a schizophrenic.

Franky is stuck in a directionless rut of cold isolation, living in a hauntingly bare apartment and working a dead-end job. However, as a uniquely spirited young man in constant pursuit of romance, Franky attempts to navigate the mercilessly harsh world of dating. There’s just one caveat: he suffers from schizophrenia and recently decided to liberate himself from his medication. After losing his job because of his illness, things take a tragically funny turn for the not-so-good.

Show.Name: Loveless Zoritsa (Crna Zorica)
Show.ShortDescription:
Everyone who falls in love with her ends up dead.

Zoritsa is enchanting. But any man who comes close enough to see her lips pucker ends up dead in the most unthinkable way. All of her past lovers’ absurd deaths point to her being magically cursed to kill off men and be the target of village hunts. And all she has is an unreliable gypsy’s fortunes, until she meets Mane, a police officer. Mane wants to clear Zoritsa’s name and follows her on her search for her curse’s cure—which entails visiting some of her old flames…and their burial grounds.

Show.Name: Lullaby For Lucious and Sumat
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 2: Looking For Something New. A short film about the love affair between a mystical woman and the Moon. The Moon leaves everything he knows to be with her, but soon learns that what he wants isn't always what he's meant to have.

Show.Name: Lunch Date
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 2: Looking For Something New. Getting dumped always hurts. Even more so when your boyfriend sends his fourteen-year-old brother to break the news.

Show.Name: Made in China (Hecho en China)
Show.ShortDescription: For his 50th birthday, Marcos receives an invitation to the wedding of the only woman he loved…30 years ago. To add to this, the Chinese Mafia is after his restaurant, and Marcos’ dream of becoming a writer seems very unattainable. So, wouldn’t the wedding be the perfect time to get away from it?
Show.ShortDescriptive1: One would think that a simple road trip across Mexico would be less…complicated.

Show.Name: Mahout
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film The Only Real Game. Sony's stunning new F55 and F5 cameras vibrantly bring Sri Lanka to life with this 4K technology of the story of an orphan girl who helps a baby elephant return to his herd in the wild.

Show.Name: Malody
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 5: Mindbenders. As an infirm young woman sits at a quiet diner conter, her surroundings become increasinly unstable. The ensuing chaos, as her world literally turns upside down, triggers an ominous sequence of events.

Show.Name: Marcel, King of Tervuren
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Animated Worlds. Marcel survives the bird flu, alcohol, sleeping pills and his son Max. Though blinded in one eye, he remains the King of Tervuren. Greek tragedy as acted out by Belgian roosters.

Show.Name: Marvin
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Animated Worlds. Marvin was born with a hole in his head, he wasn't born stupid, he wasn't born dead...

Show.Name: Matriarche
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 1: The Battles We Fought. A penitentiary parlor. A mother and her son meet for the first time since the young rebel took part in a bloody robbery.

Show.Name: The Meeting
Show.ShortDescription:
Plays with the feature film Year Of The Living Dead.
In a tiny bar in an undisclosed location, a meeting occurs. But the fate of the two men has already been decided.

Show.Name: Midnight's Children
Show.ShortDescription:
Closing Night Film and Party:
The culmination of Cinequest 23 continues our tradition of creating unforgettable events, and we proudly present our most spectacular so far with Midnight’s Children, the momentous collaboration between director Deepa Mehta and Salman Rushdie.

An epic overflowing with romance, fantasy, humor, and magic, the thrilling tale begins as two children, Saleem and Shiva, are born at midnight on August 15, 1947 – the same time that India claimed its independence from Great Britain.

Show.Name: MIMIc
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 5: Mindbenders. Tim Collin's life is slowly spiraling out of control and comes to it's breaking point in the eye of a South Florida hurricane. He seeks shelter from the massive force in an abandoned motel and just when things couldn't get worse, he discovers an old, bloack and white television that sees 15 seconds into the future.

Show.Name: The Missing Look (La Mirada Perdida)
Show.ShortDescription:
Plays with the feature film Mumbai's King.
Argentina, 1976: While her family hides from the militia, a young girl is sheltered in a fantasy world.

Show.Name: Molly Maxwell
Show.ShortDescription:
Fighting her fears of being ordinary, Molly finds freedom through forbidden romance.

There’s something about Molly Maxwell; only she doesn’t know what it is. Pressured to live up to her genius I.Q., 16-year-old Molly struggles to stand out at her alternative school. She finally copes with the expectations of her friends and family when she begins an independent study with her young, handsome English teacher.

Show.Name: Mon Ami
Show.ShortDescription:
A friend 'til the bloody end.

The owner of Hal’s Hardware Store is ready to retire. Teddy, the manager, and Cal, a lifetime employee, are overlooked in the search for a new boss. Feeling entitled to the position, they devise an obscure scheme to take what they think is rightfully theirs. These scatterbrained childhood friends are pushed to their limit, making lethal adjustments for their plan to succeed.

Show.Name: More (Yoter)
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 8: Student Shorts. Sweating and out of breath, over-weight Michael arrives late for his 7 year-old nephew's birthday pool-party. Almost 30 now, Michael is still struggling to become independent of his older domineering sister Yael. He comes ready to convince her that he no longer needs her support, but learns it's not going be an easy battle when she tells him she invited a girl to the party and it's a date.

Show.Name: Mumbai's King (Mumbai Cha Raja)
Show.ShortDescription:
A gentle, coming-of-age fable that paints an emotional and colorful portrait of Mumbai life.

A spirited boy, Rahul spends his days skipping along the rooftops of his neighborhood. To avoid his abusive father, Rahul finds sanctuary in the streets with his streetwise friends Arbaaz and Salman. While they wander the narrow passages of the city, their story unfolds through pranks, stealing food, and following Saloni, Rahul’s crush.

Show.Name: Must Have Been Love (En Som Deg)
Show.ShortDescription:
Lovers without borders.

Kasia is a Finnish girl who meets the handsome Norwegian Jacob while they are both vacationing in Istanbul. The two explore the city together the next day, and sparks fly, but Jacob’s vacation is over and he returns home. Months later, after taking a job in Oslo, Kasia searches for Jacob. She mistakes him for a man named Andreas and starts a relationship with this doppelganger even after Andreas corrects her.

Show.Name: My Universe In Lowercase (Mi Universo En Minusculas)
Show.ShortDescription:
"In this city there are no strangers, travelers are all trying to find a place, our home."
Aina, a nurse by profession, lives with her grandmother. Aina reaches Mexico City in search of her father, whom she had believed dead. Aina's only reference is a photo of a child with a note on the back: "our house on 37 Juarez street." What she finds in the vast city are many streets with that name. And given the chance to explore all of those tiny universes with the number "37", Aina experiences life in Mexico City and finds opportunities that change her forever.

Show.Name: Mystery
Show.ShortDescription:
Is it radical revenge or an accident?

Ju Lie, a mild-mannered woman with one daughter, is married to businessman Yongzhao. Leading a seemingly routine life, her world flips upside down when she spots her husband entering a hotel with another woman. This love triangle takes a turn for the worst when the other woman is struck by a car on the highway, just hours later.

Show.Name: A Night At the Office
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 3: Choice and Effect. Overachiever Annie and slacker Henry encounter an unusual office visitor while working late at their office one night.

Show.Name: Night Shift
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 2: Looking For Something New. Salote, an airport cleaner starts another long night shift. She keeps her head down, does her job and gleans her survival from what others leave behind. No one would usually spare her a second glance...

Show.Name: No One Pukes In Heaven (Im Himmel kotzt man nicht)
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 1: The Battles We Fought. Knowing that cancer will soon be tearing them apart, a little girl and her mother try to make sure of the remaining time to live life to the fullest.

Show.Name: No Rest For The Wicked
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film Twenty Million People. Spawning from the hit comic, THE DEVIL'S HANDSHAKE, this short horror-adventure romp features the title's two main characters, Basil and Moebius. Basil (Ray Park) is a street tough brawler while Moebius (Zachary Levi) plays a dashing cat burglar playboy.

Show.Name: Offline
Show.ShortDescription:
What are you willing to sacrifice for those you love?

Powerful performances by Wim Willaert (Ex Drummer) and Anemone Valcke (Oxygen, Cinequest 2012) highlight Peter Monsaert’s powerful and emotional debut feature. With the help of retired hairdresser Denise and friend Rachid, Rudy begins his journey to reclaim the life that prison took from him. But he cannot seem to get it right.

Show.Name: Oh Boy
Show.ShortDescription:
A day in the life... but oh boy, what a day!

And what a breezy, comic, light-footed, fun and funny film! Meet Niko, a young Berliner stuck in a state of in-between. As he drifts from one moment to the next, we are treated to a string of often hilarious vignettes and picture-perfect portraits, including: an encounter with a hyper-petty bureaucrat, a once fat schoolmate become skinny actress; a lovely but senile old lady and her armchair; and a beautifully portrayed old man in a bar.

Show.Name: Old Angel
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Animated Worlds. Old Angel once hurt his wings. He came to the forest to mend his wings among the colossal trees. His wings have healed, but he's been here for a long, long time. So long that he's forgotten how it feels to fly. But he just can't forget...

Show.Name: Old Stock
Show.ShortDescription:
Guilt drives some people crazy; it drives Stock to early retirement.

Old at heart, Stock Burton spends his youth living with his grandfather at the retirement home. Feigning satisfaction with his life as a pill-popping, golf-playing, 20-year-old retiree, Stock avoids facing the mistakes of his past. But when vandalism frightens the residents, the management – and inevitable reality – force Stock out of retirement.

Show.Name: One Day Or Another (El Yazisi)
Show.ShortDescription:
Just when they needed a little courage...

While striking a perfect balance between comedy and drama, this feel-good film delights and inspires audiences with its intertwining stories of hope. Nestled among towering mountains and lush greenery lies a small Turkish town where public pressure weighs heavily on three young souls. Little Ragip faces embarrassment when his innocent love letter falls into the wrong hands. Ahmet dodges rumors about a village girl whom he loves and longs to marry.

Show.Name: One Small Hitch
Show.ShortDescription:
Love's in the air - or so they’re made believe.

Childhood friends, Josh and Molly, expected a simple weekend trip for a small family wedding. Yet, Josh didn’t plan on learning about his father’s cancer before the trip. Molly didn’t plan on pretending to be engaged to him either. Josh’s white lie to please his dying father turns into a steep slippery slope as this hilarious romantic comedy proves Murphy's Law to be oh so very true.

Show.Name: The One Thing
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film The Playback Singer. Unbiased and unreserved, our youth participants express the one thing they want to see change in their communities.

Show.Name: Only Daughter
Show.ShortDescription:
Some secrets don't always stay buried.

Dawn Cowley (Emily Seymour) is 18, poor and living in rural New Hampshire, working a lackluster job at a bait shop during the day and turning tricks at night. Dawn and her mom Gail (Dakota Benedetto), along with Gail's boyfriend Billy Corbett (Seth Chatfield) live together and bicker constantly.

Show.Name: The Only Real Game
Show.ShortDescription:
They are fighters and dreamers who connect to the world through the magic of baseball.

Manipuri, India is a remote city that has been under martial law for 60 years, and where outsiders are rarely given entry. Violence, poverty, drugs, and high civilian death and HIV/AIDS rates have taken their toll on this once flourishing kingdom of artists and warriors.

Show.Name: The Orheim Company (Kompani Orheim)
Show.ShortDescription:
Director Arild Andresen won the Cinequest Audience Award with his film Liverpool Goalie at CQFF 2011 and returns with his latest coming-of-age story.

Jarlee struggles, living in what can only be described as a dysfunctional family. In any household, where each member’s distinct personality and very different dreams make functioning as a family unit difficult enough, an unpredictable alcoholic father makes it nearly impossible. Unable to stand up for himself, Jarlee finds an escape through music, politics, and girls.

Show.Name: Panihida
Show.ShortDescription:
When one person dies, the whole village celebrates her passing – and her life.

In a remote Moldovan village an old woman dies. In an act of love, remembrance, and honor, the entire village joins in carrying her casket on the long road to the cemetery. Masterful widescreen composition and almost invisible fluid editing evoke the calm rhythm of quiet nights, roiling hot days, long dusty roads, and memories of an earlier time. Every shot is a thing of wonder; breathtaking moments abound.

Show.Name: Peace
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film I Am A Director. Youths fight for peace in their homeland, empowered by one eleven year old girl and one poem, hopeful for better tomorrows.

Show.Name: The Peacefuland
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 8: Student Shorts. Today is the Chinese New Year's Eve. Fang Wei, a student who is preparing for the Entrance Exam, is afraid of attending the Family Reunion Dinner, and being asked by all family members about his future, which he has no clue. So he runs away from home...

Show.Name: Maverick Spirit - Phil Molyneux
Show.ShortDescription: Phil Molyneux is the president and chief operating officer of Sony Electronics Inc. He was appointed to the position in September 2010. In June 2011, the Sony Corp. Board of Directors elected Molyneux as a Sony Corp. Group Executive. He is also a member of the Consumer Electronics Association’s 2012 Executive Board.

Show.Name: The Playback Singer
Show.ShortDescription:
They are all works in progress.

Ray, a thirty-eight-year-old teacher turned jungle-gym architect, spends his days smoking weed and sleeping. He tells his wife, Priya (Navi Rawat, Numb3rs) that he’s “working.” But she does not see building supplies, only sketches of his yet-to-be-constructed projects. However, when her father, Ashok, moves in after years without communication, things start to change. Like Ray, Ashok, is a man lacking purpose and ignoring obligations.

Show.Name: Plimpton! Starring George Plimpton as Himself
Show.ShortDescription:
Befriending Presidents and Playboy Bunnies; Pro Athlete and Famous Writer. He was George Plimpton.

George Plimpton led a life everyone dreams of – hanging out with the rich and famous, founding an influential magazine, and playing for the Detroit Lions (if only for one infamous play). Plimpton! captures George’s strange and colorful journey in all its glory. We find George with the Kennedys in the best of times and as an eye witness to history at the worst.

Show.Name: Polski Film (Polish Film)
Show.ShortDescription:
In this film the borders between illusion and reality aren’t just blurred, they’re annihilated.

Four well-known Czech actors are making a film, playing themselves. A simple premise. But as events veer from the hilarious to the ludicrous to the positively bizarre, it stops being clear just how much is the scripted film, and how much is … something else.

Show.Name: The Pretty Time Bomb
Show.ShortDescription:
How many people does it take to arm a bomb?

Ever have a day where nothing goes right? Well... that’s Clara’s life! But one day, even her life gets worse, when her ex-boyfriend implants her with a time bomb! If that wasn’t enough, it is wirelessly connected with a metal bracelet, which will trigger the bomb if the wearer does not touch her every thirty minutes.

Show.Name: Priests (Preti)
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Animated Worlds. The growth and depth of friendship shared between two slightly homophobic priests.

Show.Name: PICTURE THE POSSIBILITIES Premiere Event
Show.ShortDescription: PTP empowers the voices of our youth...the voices of our future. A must-see event for film lovers, families, youth, and leaders excited about creating positive changes in their lives and communities.

Showing.ShortDescription: PTP empowers the voices of our youth...the voices of our future. A must-see event for film lovers, families, youth, and leaders excited about creating positive changes in their lives and communities.

Show.Name: Punched (Abgestempelt)
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 3: Choice and Effect. After being checked by the police, a young father of Arabic origin fails to explain the situation to his son -- unaware that the most inexplicable happenings of this night are yet to come.

Show.Name: The Racket Boys
Show.ShortDescription:
Three people and their pursuit of happiness.

A modern existential comedy that pays homage to French New Wave directors such as Jean-Luc Godard and Eric Rohmer, The Racket Boys is also a tribute to the creative spirit, passion, and our individuality.

Show.Name: Rice Submergence Tolerance
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film Plimpton! Starring George Plimpton As Himself. Rice provides up to two thirds of the diet of many people living in the developing world and one fifth of all calories consumed on the earth. But rice farms cannot withstand the more frequently occurring floods that encroach on the main rice farms due to global warming. Thanks to Pamela C. Ronald, David Mackill, and Kenong Xu, a submergence tolerance gene has been identified and molecular breeding has transferred the gene to a number of local varieties of rice.

Show.Name: Right Here Among Us
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film We Went To War. Homeboy Industry believes “Nothing stops a bullet like a gun”, pulling gang members to brighter futures through work and compassion.

Show.Name: Rock
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Short Program 8: Student Shorts. Alone and bored with his life indoors, a young boy ventures outdoors to his favorite swimming hole, only to find it already occupied. A showdown ensues, but is the outcome worth it?

Show.Name: Romance
Show.ShortDescription: This is a true romantic comedy, Chuck Palahniuk style. The author of Fight Club brings you John: a man who feels blessed that, for someone who aimed so low, he got the golden trophy. Her name is Britney. It’s Britney Spears, actually, and she’s just as hot. She may have some sort of drug problem. She seems stoned…a lot of the time. She doesn’t need to be perfect, though. It’s how much he loves her that makes her perfect. Plus, she is the epitome of sexy, using playful language and leaving the end of her sentences hanging in the air all mysteriously. She’s so out of his league. You couldn’t pull him from the clouds; it’s so perfect.

Show.Name: Route Of The Moon (Ruta De La Luna)
Show.ShortDescription:
Father and son... bonding time?

Being different is no easy task. And when the difference is so visible, like albinism, or so burdensome, like a heart condition, things get harder. Albino introvert Tito must travel from Panama to Costa Rica to pick up his sick father. Not having spoken to his father in years, their reunion is less than desired.

Show.Name: Running Wild: The Life of Dayton O. Hyde
Show.ShortDescription:
A colorful cowboy/poet tries to save the wild horses of the West.

Adventurous and romantic stories about The American West are a thing of the past—until one meets Dayton O. Hyde. From World War II to Berkeley to cattle drives and rodeos, this imposing cowboy/poet tells his colorful story with the wisdom and insight of a man who is at peace with himself and his world. Nearing the end of his remarkable life, Hyde embarks on one last mission: to save and protect the vanishing wild horses of The West.

CustomProperty.Name: Executive Producer
CustomProperty.Value: Barbara Kopple, Robert Johnson, Alejandro Perez

Show.Name: Safe Agua Peru
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with feature film La Camioneta: The Journey Of One American School Bus. The Safe Agua Team from the Art Center College of Design found that in Cerro Verde, a slum in Peru, 30,000 people live without access to running water and sanitation. In response, they designed and created alongside Cerro Verde families products that would help conserve water, reduce illness, and stimulate economic change.

Show.Name: Safety Last
Show.ShortDescription: This year the Stanford Theatre Foundation brings two of the greatest comedic talents of silent film to Cinequest: Buster Keaton and Harold Lloyd.

Showing.ShortDescription: This year the Stanford Theatre Foundation brings two of the greatest comedic talents of silent film to Cinequest: Buster Keaton and Harold Lloyd.

Show.Name: Maverick Spirit - Salman Rushdie
Show.ShortDescription: Throughout his long, esteemed career, writer Salman Rushdie has embodied the spirit of the maverick, creating works as he chooses, telling the truth as he sees it, always conscious of his role as an artist.
Show.ExtraHTML: This is part of the closing night event and is not available as a separate ticket.

Show.Name: The Sapphires
Show.ShortDescription:
Winner of 11 Australian Academy Awards!

If you’re looking for that festival feel-good hit, The Sapphires is pure delight! Set during the Vietnam War—and based on a true story—the tale about four vibrant and talented young Aboriginal girls plucked from obscurity to entertain the troops is brimming with Motown hits, love, humor, and spunk.

Show.Name: The Scar (La Cicatrice)
Show.ShortDescription:
The games children play are not always innocent...

How does one build a future on a lifetime of failure? The deepest scars are not always the most visible ones, and the one Richard carries within him has been open ever since one evening in a barn when he was a child, and his life changed forever. Thirty years later, he has returned to that same place looking for revenge. Between realism and fantasy, The Scar draws an intense psychological suspense through one man’s confrontation with his past.

Show.Name: Shorts Program 1: The Battles We Fought
Show.ShortDescription: Not every war is fought on a battlefield or even between nations. These stories show that the pains of fighting our demons, painful pasts, failing bodies, and held prejudices - and some actual wars as well. Ranging from intensely personal films to paranoid discussions to action-packed thrill rides, these films will explore wounds suffered out on the battlefield and alone at home.

Show.Name: Shorts Program 2: Looking for Something New
Show.ShortDescription: The most frustrating search is one for meaning. We find what we do not seek, overlook what we search for, and feel every emotion along the way. These films explore internal trials and journeys for something larger out in the world. But whether a messenger boy, a robot, or the moon, one can never be sure of what hope will bring.

Show.Name: Shorts Program 3: Choice and Effect
Show.ShortDescription: Life demands tough decisions. Should we offer a hand to help? Should we let a relationship go? Should we risk ourselves for another? Every answer leads to a different path, a different journey. But deciding can be a journey as well. This sprawling collection of short films explores turning points that afect the characters and those around them in profound ways.

Show.Name: Shorts Program 4: Animated Worlds
Show.ShortDescription: Cinequest is proud to present Animated Worlds, a showcase of ingenious animations from around the world. There's everything from creatures scampering about, to images of dire decay, to creative fusions of imagination by world-class animators. Science fiction dances with fantasy, magic with mirth, danger with dreams. No style, technique, or tone is the same. Come see in what animated world you belong!

Show.Name: Shorts Program 5: Mindbenders
Show.ShortDescription: The masterful minds of these shorts toy with our sanity, thrilling and warping our minds as we wonder what is the real truth. Their worlds are like webs, clarity seeming impossible to grasp. All you know is not to judge a book by its cover and that you are never safe, whether in an abandoned motel or in the confines of your own mind.

Show.Name: Shorts Program 6: Docu-Nation
Show.ShortDescription: There is no better way to be inspired than by hearing people speak their minds and hearts. These nine films will explore people's different views of art, meditation, life, and death. They'll look closer and discover how much or how little individuals feel at peace with themselves and the rest of the world. Harrowing, amusing, touching, powerful, and raw. These stories captivate with their authenticity.

Show.Name: Shorts Program 7: Time, Space, And In Between
Show.ShortDescription: Time and space make up a setting, but can also conduct a spark in the characters on set. From Calcutta's chaotic streets to an Australian lake, from an interrogation room to a shrink's office, from the past to the future to a trip between the two - this collection of shorts features tales of people whose particular surroundings push them to unexpected dimensions.

Show.Name: Shorts Program 8: Student Shorts
Show.ShortDescription: At some point, we all grapple with the role of family in our lives. This year, for the Student Short Film Program, filmmakers consider family. What makes up today's "traditional" household? How do different generations get on the same level? Is family a driving force, a stifling hindrance, a support system? Can it weather the storms? When should it stick together or loosen up? These inspired stories will explore some answers.

Show.Name: Simpa Network
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film The Believers. Four hundred million people in India and 1.5 billion worldwide do not have access to reliable electricity. Simpa Networks found a solution that earned them the Accenture Sustainable Energy Award at The Tech Awards 2012. They established a solar home system that allows for families in off-grid areas to have an affordable, pay-as-you-use solar energy solution.

Show.Name: Sky Burial
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 6: Docu-Nation. Death can be feared, sensationalized, romanticized... but it cannot be ignored. Other than birth, it is the single most universal and transformative event in our lives. However each of us meets our fate, communities around the world mark this moment with unique and ancient traditions.

Show.Name: Sleight Of Hand
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Animated Worlds. Sleight of Hand. A set of techniques used by someone to manipulate objects secretly to deceive. This is a stop-motion film about illusions. A Man yearns to know his place in the world and how he fits in, when sometimes it's better not to know.

Show.Name: Solace
Show.ShortDescription:
Six people. Three stories. One truth.

The marriage of socialite Kathryn (Rhoda Griffis, The Blind Side) and her politician husband (Ric Reitz, Flight) is falling apart. They each struggle to keep their secret second lives concealed, while trying to restore their once love-filled relationship. A lawyer (Robert Pralgo, The Vampire Diaries) battles wits with a streetwise hustler, risking everything to save his credibility.

Show.Name: Somewhere Slow
Show.ShortDescription:
Can a teenager piece together a broken woman?

Intimate, raw and at times funny, Somewhere Slow is a searing and complex portrait of Anna Thompson (Jessalyn Gilsig, Glee), a 40 year old skin care rep coasting through an unfulfilled marriage to Robert (David Costabile, Lincoln) and an estranged relationship with her family. When Anna gets mixed-up in a deadly convenience store robbery, she makes the split-decision to walk out of her life, into the unknown.

Show.Name: South Seas Dream
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Animated Worlds. The spirits of the Oceanic realm dance and frolic on a South Seas beach. Can you hear their song? Found footage, video of Tiki objects d'art, and stage-of-the-art digital composing are combined to create a surreal tropical.

Show.Name: The Space Jockey Pursuit
Show.ShortDescription:
Two brothers, two dreams, one goal: to achieve them.

Sincere and humorous, Brian Titshaw’s debut comedy captures the journey where nothing seems to go as planned. Space Jockey is the most talked about role in Hollywood, and the producers want to cast an unknown. And no one is more unknown than Alvin Bernstein. But in order to break into Hollywood, Alvin must first break out of the nuthouse.

Show.Name: Sparks
Show.ShortDescription:
With great power, comes greater villains.

Based on his own cult comic hit, Christopher Folino’s groundbreaking superhero noir thriller follows Ian Sparks (Chase Williamson, John Dies at the End), a young man destined to protect others from the grips of evil. He may not have the physical prowess of other Supers, but his lovable charm easily captures the heart of the beautiful Lady Heavenly (Ashley Bell, The Last Exorcism).

Show.Name: Spotlight on Spartan Films
Show.ShortDescription: Cinequest Distribution and Cinequest Mavericks Studio works to promote, create, co-create, and distribute films of either content originality and artistic impact, or films that utilize new technologies or new marketing paradigms. This year, Cinequest Distribution spotlights a production company, Spartan Films, which has created a unique approach to making films: integrating seasoned professionals with college talent to produce not student films but marketable professional films.

Show.Name: Stable Life
Show.ShortDescription:
An undocumented worker gambles on her own life at the track.

Dionicia lives in a small room in the back of a Bay Area racetrack, tending to horses and raising her family in the squalor of her surroundings. As an undocumented worker, Dionicia takes pride in the fact that her kids can dream of a better life due to the risks and sacrifices she is willing to bear.

Show.Name: Start the Engine and Reverse
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 3: Choice and Effect. A young couple driving on an isolated road knocks over a pedestrian. Their first reaction to assist the man is rapidly rejected because the two lovers have reasons to hide their affair. The girl presses her boyfriend to finish-off the wounded man. The road accident becomes a real murder...

Show.Name: Still
Show.ShortDescription:
James Cromwell and Geneviève Bujold give powerful performances in a deeply affecting love story.

Cantankerous and stubborn, Craig Morrison (Cromwell) is used to doing things for himself on his rural farm. He’s kept his farm afloat due to the support and love of his wife, Irene (Bujold), who’s just as tough as he is.

Showing.ShortDescription:
James Cromwell and Geneviève Bujold give powerful performances in a deeply affecting love story.

Show.Name: Strangeface
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 7: Time, Space, And In Between. Ten year old Ana longs for a friend but her odd attempts to connect freak other kids out. Retreating into the bush for another day of lone exploring, she comes across a stranger intent on drowning a puppy in the river. Horrified, Ana battles her fear and confronts the man, saving the dog and unexpectedly finding the companionship she has craved.

Show.Name: Sweet Talk
Show.ShortDescription:
A story as true as you want it to be.

This unexpected love story shouldn’t have happened: Delilah (Natalie Zea, Justified) is distant and emotionally dry, Samson wants to live in his imagination, yet when Delilah answers his call to a phone sex number, they both weave a tale even they confuse with reality. She unleashes men’s fantasies while he seeks inspiration.

Show.Name: Tango Abrazos
Show.ShortDescription:
If tango be the moves of love, dance on. Oh yes, dance on.

Two couples in present day Ljubljana enroll in a dance school for tango, and in the process learn a great deal more – about life, about love, about themselves. Both are happy, long-established couples, secure in their partnerships, but “tango is a horizontal thought expressed in a vertical position,” and as they share dancing partners they become friends, affections blur, forgotten feelings are reawakened.
