Show.Name: Tatau
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 8: Student Shorts. Siaki, an elderly Samoan man struggles to come to terms with the lifelong shame of having an incomplete traditional tattoo when he is confronted with the shame of his sight. As Siaki's vision deteriorates, memories of the painful tattooing ceremony he underwent in his youth haunt him as he yearns to see his tattoo completed before it's too late.

Show.Name: Taxi Driver
Show.ShortDescription:
Considered among the best films of all time, Martin Scorsese's gritty masterpiece stars Robert De Niro, Jodie Foster, Harvey Keitel, Albert Brooks, and Cybill Shepherd.
An alienated and quiet loner, taxi driver Travis Bickle (De Niro) works the night shift in Manhattan. After failing to land a date with Betsy (Shepard), a beautiful campaign aide for presidential candidate Palentine (Leonard Harris), an encounter with a 12-year-old prostitute, Iris (Foster), and her pimp, Sport (Keitel), convinces Travis that the world is a rotten place.

Showing.ShortDescription:
Considered among the best films of all time, Martin Scorsese's gritty masterpiece stars Robert De Niro, Jodie Foster, Harvey Keitel, Albert Brooks, and Cybill Shepherd.
An alienated and quiet loner, taxi driver Travis Bickle (De Niro) works the night shift in Manhattan. After failing to land a date with Betsy (Shepard), a beautiful campaign aide for presidential candidate Palentine (Leonard Harris), an encounter with a 12-year-old prostitute, Iris (Foster), and her pimp, Sport (Keitel), convinces Travis that the world is a rotten place.

Show.Name: Taxidermists
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 6: Docu-Nation. Dennis Harris and Wendy Christensen have been creating taxidermy since they were children. Today Dennis owns his own shop where he creates suspension taxidermy and Wendy works in a museum maintaining dioramas. They both compete in the World Taxidermy Championships with their creations and try to find a balance between art and science in their work.

Show.Name: TeachAIDS
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film We Were Children. Hundreds of millions of dollars have been spent over the past thirty years to bring awareness to AIDS, but TeachAIDS aims to focus on educating their audiences. This organization earned the Microsoft Education Award at The Tech Awards 2012 because of the great effectiveness of their educational campaign, which has a specific approach and style to each demographic addressed. TeachAIDS has provided HIV education to more than 200 organizations and governments in 73 countries, including regions that had banned sex education.

Show.Name: Thicker Than Blood
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 8: Student Shorts. The meaning of family in American society today has come a long way since its ideals were molded into the concept of the nuclear family.

Show.Name: Three Light Bulbs
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 8: Student Shorts. When a young engineer returns to her rural Chinese village to share the solar technology that she's been developing, she must first win over her long-neglected father. Bound by love, they have to overcome their differences and come to final understanding of each other. The film sees Energy Saving, a global environmental issue on a microcosmic and human level.

Show.Name: Three Sixty
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 7: Time, Space, And In Between. Two youths, eager to make a quick buck, accept a job from a nightclub owner to kidnap the girlfriend of a famous football players. In a turn of mistaken identity, the kidnapped girl convinces our bemused boys that she is really the daughter of a New York Mafia family and, should they not release her pronto, her 'hit man' brother will track them down.

Show.Name: Tis In My Memory Locked (En Mi Memoria Queda Guardado)
Show.ShortDescription:
Plays with the feature film Route Of The Moon.
While rehearsing for her ultimate role, an actress begins to lose her sense of reality.

Show.Name: Transforming Arsenic Crisis into an Economic Enterprise
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film La Camioneta: The Journey Of One American School Bus. In Cambodia, Nepal, India, Bangladesh, and Vietnam, more than 200 people are threatened by arsenic poisoning from the only water resource they have available. Arup K. SenGuta’s effort that won him the Intel Environment Award at The Tech Awards 2012, Transforming Arsenic into an Economic Enterprise, found a filter material that is successful in removing the water’s concentrations of arsenic.

Show.Name: Tule Lake
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 8: Student Shorts. Based on true events, Tule Lake is story of perseverance, shown from the perspective of a Japanese American internee during World War II. Held in the Tule Lake segregation camp with her family, a woman steps out of her barracks one winter night...

Show.Name: Twenty Million People
Show.ShortDescription:
The clever Casanova finally meets his match.

This isn’t your typical romantic comedy. Brian believes all relationships are doomed from the start, but during the screening of a cheesy romantic comedy called “Future Perfect,” Brian meets Ashley, the only girl as cynical and callous as he is. A one-night stand turns into casual sex, which turns into dates, and before they know it…Brian is in love. Yet when Ashley disappears, leaving Brian without notice, he doesn’t want to return to his comedic, bachelor life.

Show.Name: Urban Outlaw
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film Family Meals. URBAN OUTLAW is a portrait of Magnus Walker, the rebel Porsche customizer who turned a hobby into an obsession, and an obsession into a successful business. From a workshop in downtown Los Angeles, Magnus obsessively harvests fragments from donor Porsche 911s...

Show.Name: VIP Soiree - 360 Residences
Show.ShortDescription:
This happy hour gathering connects a vibrant mix of artists, innovators, executives, and film lovers. Enjoy delicious cocktails and world class food hosted Willow Street Pizza, while exchanging ideas and inspirations at 360 Residences.

Exclusive to All Access pass Holders.

VIP All Acess Passes are available on our Festival Pass Page

Exclusive to All Access pass Holders.

VIP All Acess Passes are available on our Festival Pass Page

Show.Name: Wade Krause: Pinball Artist
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 6: Docu-Nation. Unwilling to let pinball die at the hand of video games, master screen printer and craftsman Wade Krause reinvents and restores everything pinball. Wade collaborates with pop artists like Dirty Donny on custom games from a labyrinthine workshop in a rural California rodeo town. Wade is one of the leading craftsman of New Pinball; enter his mad scientist pinball lab and see what happens behind the multicolored backglass.

Show.Name: Wampler's Ascent
Show.ShortDescription:
An impossible dream to scale EL CAPITAN comes to life.

Steve Wampler had the same dream as all other rock climbers: to conquer Yosemite’s El Capitan. But Steve is far different from other climbers: he has cerebral palsy. No one with his condition has ever reached the top of the terrorizing sheer wall. With the unconditional support from his wife Elizabeth and their two children, Steve sets off to do the undoable.

Show.Name: We Went To War
Show.ShortDescription:
Over 40 years later, their story continues.

In 1970, Michael Grisby’s acclaimed film, I Was a Soldier, followed three young veterans as they returned from Vietnam to the Texas heartland, documenting the cataclysmic effect of their wartime experiences. Now, 40 years later, we are taken back to Texas to discover how the scars of battle and the intervening years have changed the lives of these same soldiers.

Show.Name: We Were Children
Show.ShortDescription:
A story of innocence: Not Lost. Stolen.

For over 130 years, the Indian Residential School system plucked generations worth of Aboriginal children from their homes in an effort to erase their culture, and this now-unthinkable practice has finally been dramatized on screen with force, compassion, and a sharp visual design. Jason Sherman’s script sticks closely to the childrens’ accounts, and never flinches in telling the dark truths of this little-known chapter in Canadian history.

Show.Name: WECARE Solar
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film Wampler's Ascent. Past recipient (2011) of the Nokia Health Award at The Tech Awards 2011, We Care Solar’s Solar Suitcase Installations are wonderfully transforming the quality of care in Africa, Haiti, and other low resource areas. These installations power medical and surgical lighting, mobile communication devices, and medical devices.

Show.Name: Welcome Home
Show.ShortDescription:
A conflicted love-letter to a city and a woman in constant states of self-renewal.

Crafting a psychologically intense drama that reveals three moments in a woman’s life, director Tom Heene’s haunting debut combines intimacy, eroticism, and brutally raw emotions to depict a portrait of a city and a people in a state of flux.

Crafting a psychologically intense drama that reveals three moments in a woman’s life, director Tom Heene’s haunting debut combines intimacy, eroticism, and brutally raw emotions to depict a portrait of a city and a people in a state of flux.

A conflicted love-letter to a city and a woman in constant states of self-renewal.

Show.Name: Where We Are Safe
Show.ShortDescription: Plays with the feature film The Almost Man. To escape the claws of the bay area’s underbelly, fear-stricken youths seek shelter away from dark corners.

Show.Name: White Lie
Show.ShortDescription:
Roles reverse in a quest for vengeance.

In this riveting neo-noir thriller of ever-growing suspense, an aspiring writer takes justice into his own hands after his mentor robs him of his dignity. Following eight years of working as an assistant for renowned author Richard Westfield, Sydney proudly presents him with the manuscript of his very first novel.

Show.Name: Why Are You Here (Dlaczego Tutaj Jestes)
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 1: The Battles We Fought. For a group of German soldiers trapped in no man’s land at the end of WWII, a remote shack in the countryside with a sniper in it stands between them and survival. But none of the soldiers can guess what really confronts them behind the walls of this idle outpost in the woods.

Show.Name: Wild Geese
Show.ShortDescription:
Plays with the feature film Girl Shaped Love Drug.
It's the first day of Barbara's retirement...the first day of the rest of her life.

Show.Name: The Wound
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 5: Mindbenders. Released from the hospital into her aunt’s care, a woman tries to recuperate from abdominal surgery at an idyllic coastal home. One morning her surgical wound comes to life and becomes a ravenous maw that eats without mercy, consuming anything and anyone that comes near.

Show.Name: Writers Celebration
Show.ShortDescription: "What if...?" A simple two word question with endless possibilities that story tellers have been posing for thousands of years. What we experience on the screen began as words flowing across a page, emerging from a writers imagination.

Showing.ShortDescription: "What if...?" A simple two word question with endless possibilities that story tellers have been posing for thousands of years. What we experience on the screen began as words flowing across a page, emerging from a writers imagination.

Show.Name: Year of the Living Dead
Show.ShortDescription:
The true story of the scariest movie of all time.

George Romero’s Night of the Living Dead is not only the quintessential zombie movie, it also invented the genre. Director Rob Kuhns goes behind the scenes to discover how Romero put together this groundbreaking film, interspersing clips of the movie and conversations with the actors, film historians, and Romero himself, who spins hilarious tales about how he went from working on Mr. Rogers’ Neighborhood to creating one of the great horror films of all-time.

Show.Name: Yellow Sticky Notes | Canadian Anijam
Show.ShortDescription: Part of Shorts Program 4: Animated Worlds. For the first time in Canadian history, 15 of Canada's most award-winning and celebrated independent animators have come together to create one collaborative animated film.
